other_tests.findings: Thrombus in the left iliac vein, flow within the right iliac artery, and absence of flow in the left iliac vein.
Patent renal and mesenteric vasculature, clot in the left ascending lumbar vein.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient's pain and renal function improved over the next several days.

other_tests.findings: 1+ protein and 4+ blood, with more than 20 red cells and 3 to 5 white cells per high-power field.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Hematuria symptoms gradually resolved during the next several weeks.

other_tests.findings: Thrombus in the left iliac vein but no evidence of mesenteric or renal vein thrombosis.
Creatinine level rose from 1.1 mg/dL to 1.3 mg/dL, then to 1.5 mg/dL.
